RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THREE RIVERS brushed the near side stall at the start before taking over the lane of rival to her inside who had a troubled beginning, showed the way early on from the two path before being displaced from the front by JUSTTHEFACTSJACK nine-sixteenths from home, tucked inside and advanced on that rival prompting along the rail through the turn before taking narrow advantage spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, got roused straightened away and edged clear under a drive to prevail. RISK FREE coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to just get up for the place honors. JUSTTHEFACTSJACK brushed the off side stall at the start, raced three wide in aim early on before advancing to split foes taking command at the nine-sixteenths, tucked to the two path through the turn facing pressure to the inside by the eventual winner, got headed spinning three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive running on to the finish but was nailed for the place honors in the final jump. WICKSIEPIXIE coaxed from the gate, strode green early on three wide growing detached at the tail of the field, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, tired. AVALANCHE IS COMIN tossed her head just as the latch was sprung and got away last conceding three lengths to the front before settling into stride, came under coaxing five paths off the inside and rushed up to be with the majority of the field into the turn, tucked three wide at the half mile pole before tucking to the two path placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and faltered in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Justthefactsjack
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, 3w in aim, up 9/16, 2p turn, yielded 3w uppr, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Wicksiepixie
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, strode green 3w early, 2p turn, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Avalanche Is Comin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head st, rushed 5p, 3-2w turn, 2w 1/4p, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Three Rivers
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, led early 2p, prompted ins turn, up 2w 1/4, edged clr

ENTRY.NAME: Risk Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, mild kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1M Turf CR: 83. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO SHOW SAMMY JO (GB) was reserved near the middle of the field on the outside, moved closer while three then four wide on the turn, rallied to the lead in upper stretch then kicked clear outside the furlong marker and proved best under steady urging. BEST PERFORMER was last to commence, raced towards the rear under restraint, moved from the two path to the four path while let out on the turn, was roused five wide into the stretch and finished willingly for the place. MACHIAVELLIQUE showed the way early while in hand, lost the lead near the three-quarter pole then stalked on the outside, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked late on that bend, turned into upper stretch under a drive, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened but just held the show. RIVER TAY (IRE) was rated under a snug hold, drafted two to three wide on the turn, gained to make a bid at the quarter-pole then battled with foes under a drive, dropped back into the final furlong and also weakened then just missed the show. NO DELI (IRE) broke near the rear of the field, was reserved on the outside towards the back, moved from three to five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and improved to just miss the superfecta. FIZZY settled in the early going, steadied while taken in hand behind horses inside the seven-eighths, was reserved towards the rear, saved ground while put to coaxing on the turn, was roused near the five-sixteenths, shifted four wide near the quarter-pole then was placed under light urging into upper stretch, remained under mild urging while behind foes until near the sixteenth-pole then was removed from cover, was given one token pop of a right-handed crop late and failed to threaten then galloped out in front with interest. LA MAZEL was hustled from the gate, steadied inside the seven-eighths, settled near the middle of the field, saved ground while roused on the turn, shifted three wide into the stretch then tipped further out and lacked the needed response. IDLE CHATTER pulled keenly on the bit under stout restraint, dropped in early on the backstretch, was rated off the pace, saved ground on the turn, was asked for her best in upper stretch and came up empty. JUST A SPLASH (IRE) broke out then was corrected by the rider, moved forward while in hand, went to the front with six furlongs to run, showed the way on the inside of a rival, vied inside on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage in upper stretch and gave way. EVITA dropped back early then paused in traffic near the seven-eighths, was reserved towards the back, traveled around the turn in the two path and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Just a Splash (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,to front3/4,pace in hand,ins turn,headed3/16,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: La Mazel
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,stdy6-1/2,reserved,inside turn,3w1/4,tipped out,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: No Deli (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: at back,reserved outside,3-5w turn,6w into lane,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Fizzy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stdy6-1/2,rsrvd,ins trn,ask5/16,4w1/4,mld urging to1/16,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Best Performer
ENTRY.OWNER: Kirk Kat and Sanders Wayne R
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,reserved,2-4p turn,5path into lane,willingly for place

ENTRY.NAME: Machiavellique
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace in hand,stalked outside,2path turn,ask1/4,weakened,held3rd

ENTRY.NAME: River Tay (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated,snug hold,2-3path turn,bid1/4,drop back 1/8,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Evita
ENTRY.COMMENT: drop back,paused7/8,reserved,2path turn,failed to threaten

ENTRY.NAME: Idle Chatter
ENTRY.OWNER: Magnier Mrs John Magnier Mrs M V and Shanahan Mrs Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: pulled,keen,rated,inside turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: No Show Sammy Jo (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Bridlewood Farm and Madaket Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved outside,3-4w turn,rallied1/4,lead3/16,clear1/8,driving

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Fittocks Stud & St Albans Bloodstock Ltd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 37000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherw ise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EMPIRE RIDE brushed the off side stall at the start and came under hustling, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive taking command just inside the eighth pole, then edged away to the finish kept to task. URAGANO coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide coming under a prolonged drive from the nine-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and ran on to secure the place honors. LABARDE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside coming under coaxing nearing the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was collared just inside the eighth pole, weakened in the late stages. STRONG LIGHT chased three to four wide at the tail of the field early on, advanced with five and a half furlongs to run tucking to the two path at the nine-sixteenths before taking to the inside half a mile out, moved into contention midway on the turn when put to coaxing, took the inside route into upper stretch, then weakened in the late going. SCOTTO coaxed from the gate, chased five to six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked briefly three wide placed to coaxing at the nine-sixteenths before tipping four wide half a mile from home, continued four wide through the turn, then went five wide into upper stretch and weakened. PAPI ON ICE chased three then two wide before tucking inside five furlongs out, came under coaxing with three furlongs remaining, angled out six wide into upper stretch and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Labarde
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4, collared, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, advanced 5 1/2, ins turn, ins 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Uragano
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 9/16, 4w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Papi On Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, to ins 5/8, coaxed ins 3/8, 6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Scotto
ENTRY.OWNER: Cipriano Vito Scotti Neil Alfleri Anthony and Bochilo Vincent
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 5-6w, coaxed 3w 9/16, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Empire Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, hustled st, 4-3w pursuit, 3w uppr, up, edged away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 93. Claiming Purse 48000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Other wise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRINCE JAMES was well placed down the backstretch, moved closer near the nine-sixteenths, ranged up on the wayward winner in the two path early on the turn, inherited the lead with three furlongs to run, moved clear passing the five-sixteenths, extended the advantage into upper stretch, responded well in the final furlong and proved much the best under steady urging. WINNING DRIVE settled at the rear on the outside, was urged while gaining four wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and safely secured the place. THREE TWO ZONE settled on the outside, moved closer late on the backstretch, made a bid in the three to four path on the turn, dropped back late on that bend, chased into the stretch and weakened while just able to get the show. RISK PROFILE was taken up some while shut-off at the start, settled towards the back, was roused three wide on the turn and lacked the needed response then just missed the show. PRINTRACK broke out while away very fast, quickly opened up a sizable advantage while lugging out some, began to lug out more late on the backstretch, gave up the advantage while bearing out from the five path to the ten path on the turn, dropped to the rear before the five-sixteenths, floated about fifteen wide into the stretch under a vigorous left-rein grip, was put to urging after straightening for the drive, pursued foes for the minor awards to the finish and just missed the show while near the outside of the track.

ENTRY.NAME: Prince James
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,closer4-1/2,2p turn,inherited lead3/8,drew away

ENTRY.NAME: Printrack
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,away fast,pace,lug out,bore out 10w turn,15w1/4,miss3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Risk Profile
ENTRY.OWNER: La Marca Stable and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: shut off start,tkn up some,settled,ask 3w turn,missed show

ENTRY.NAME: Three Two Zone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,closer 4-1/2,3-4path turn,bid3/8,drp back1/4,wknd,held3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Drive
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,gained 4wide turn,safely secured place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 6F Inner turf CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. INNER TURF (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Si nce December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DISARMED lightly coaxed along showing the way just off the inside, tucked inside through the turn under some pressure from MY SEA COTTAGE, came under urging at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat clinging to command and stubbornly fended off the challenge to prevail on the wire. MY SEA COTTAGE (IRE) broke in at the start taking over the lane of DON'T LET ME DOWN, prompted the pace three then two wide, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive on near even terms inside the eighth pole but couldn't go by and was ultimately rebuffed at the end. HIGHLY FLAMMABLE four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and missed at the finish closing in late. KING JAMES chased along the inside, got let out taking the inside route into upper stretch, ran on to secure the last major share. KING MOONRACER chased four then three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid but was outkicked. BUCKORTWO chased three then two wide, got set down spinning three wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid but was outkicked. RELATE broke a beat slow, chased three then two wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, offered no rally. DON'T LET ME DOWN broke a half a beat slow and lost his to MY SEA COTTAGE, chased along the inside under a ride from the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and made no headway. JESTER'S SONG chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, got let out swinging just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Let Me Down
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 slw, chased inside, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: My Sea Cottage (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, prompted 3-2w, set down 2w 1/4p, dug in, rebuffed

ENTRY.NAME: Jester's Song
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, inside turn, let out 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: King James
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, let out ins 1/4, ran on

ENTRY.COMMENT: off beat slw, chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 6w upper, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Disarmed
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Gurdon Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: lightly coaxed on pace 2p, ins turn, ins 1/4, dug in, stubborn

ENTRY.NAME: Buckortwo
ENTRY.OWNER: J and N Stables and Diamond M Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, set down 3w upper, bid, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: King Moonracer
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 4-5w upper, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Highly Flammable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, dug in, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Wild Applause S. BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1M Turf CR: 96. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake lifetime or a race other than maiden, claiming, starter or state bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 10, 2023 with 35 Nominations. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIGURIA charged the front of the gate just before the latch was sprung and came away clearly in front, dropped back then settled off the pace, fell to the rear while patiently handled on the turn, was roused while swinging seven wide into upper stretch, rallied outside to make a bid inside the furlong marker, took the lead into the final sixteenth and proved best under good handling. TAX IMPLICATIONS (GB) settled at the rear, was roused three wide on the turn, rallied six wide into the stretch, closed strongly to get the lead outside the furlong marker, led to the sixteenth-pole then was headed by the winner and missed while clear for the place. SOVIET EXCESS brushed with a rival at the start, tracked the pace on the outside while in hand, was given her cue in the three path on the turn, gained four wide into the stretch, took the lead near the three-sixteenths, lost the advantage to the runner-up outside the furlong marker and weakened but just held the show. CECILE brushed with a foe leaving the gate, was hard held while rank between foes onto the backstretch, raced under tight restraint towards the back, traveled three wide on the turn, gained five wide into the stretch, made a bid between foes outside the furlong marker but also weakened then just missed the show. BREATH AWAY (GB) bumped solidly with an opponent at the start, was rank under steadying restraint onto and early on the backstretch then reserved off the pace, drafted in the two path on the turn, waited briefly coming to the quarter-pole then was asked three wide into the stretch, raced behind foes under a solid hand-ride to the furlong marker then angled out and lacked the needed response. IM JUST KIDDIN was taken under a tight hold early, became very rank under steadying restraint onto and early on the backstretch, tracked the pace under a tight hold, was let out in the two path on the far turn, came under a drive in upper stretch and tired. VIOLET GIBSON (IRE) settled off the pace, saved ground on the turn, was asked late on that bend, chased behind horses in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and capitulated. KERRY bumped solidly with a rival at the start, moved up in hand to take the lead then went clear, vied inside on the turn, lost the advantage in upper stretch and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Violet Gibson (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside turn, chased behind foes 3/16, empty

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled at rear,roused 3w turn,6w1/4,rallied,led1/8-1/16,caught

ENTRY.COMMENT: chargd front of gate,awy fst,settled,2p turn,ask1/4,swung7w,rally

ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank7/8,stdying restraint,rated,tracked,2p turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cecile
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,rank7/8,hard held,3w turn,5w1/4,bid1/8,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Soviet Excess
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,tracked outside,ask3w turn,4w1/4,led3/16,headed,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,mvd up in hand,clear pace,ins turn,headed3/16,gave way

ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Tango Uniform Racing LLC and Rocco Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,rank7/8,stdying restraint,ratd,wait1/4,mvd out1/8,no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 42000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At T ime Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRUCULENT chased just off the inside, tucked inside through the turn remaining patiently handled, cut the corner into upper stretch and was roused straightened away, rallied to issue a challenge through the final furlong taking narrow command nearing the sixteenth marker, then dug in gamely to fend off a pair of rivals to the finish. HIGHER QUALITY grew fractious, the rider dismounting to be assisted by pony when coming onto the track and got loose, ran off during the post parade jogging along for three furlongs into the clubhouse turn before being apprehended and returned by outrider, broke awkward at the start pulling on the bit, then gave chase five to six paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking three wide through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, seized narrow command at the three-sixteenths, dug in between foes getting collared nearing the sixteenth marker and fought on gamely between rivals to the finish. COOL QUARTET chased along the inside down the backstretch before tipping to the two path at the half mile pole, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths and tipped out to be four wide midway on the turn, continued four wide into upper stretch, rallied outside a trio and then a pair battling on to the finish but was ultimately staved off while clear for the show honors. GRUMPS LITTLE TOTS chased four then three wide until tucked to the two path when placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and improved position to secure the last major share. JALEN JOURNEY stumbled at the start, showed the way in hand four paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch under threat to the outside, yielded the front with three-sixteenths to run and weakened to the finish. BLAKE B. chased three then two wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled four wide into upper stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Cool Quartet
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, tip 2p 1/2, coax 4w 3/8, 4w uppr, dug in, battled on

ENTRY.NAME: Truculent
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, ins turn, cut corner, roused, up near 1/16, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Blake B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Grumps Little Tots
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-3w, coaxed 2p 3/8, 2w 1/4p, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Jalen Journey
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, in hand 4p, 2p turn, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Higher Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, 5-6w early, 3w turn, 3w uppr, up 3/16, collared, game

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 94. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PIONEERING SPIRIT was taken back early then angled in, saved ground on the first turn, was reserved towards the back, moved closer with five furlongs to run, traveled two then three wide on the far turn, was roused four wide into the stretch then moved further out while brushing with a foe, bumped with another foe while rallying inside the three-sixteenths, closed fast to get the lead coming to the sixteenth-pole then powered away under good handling. ROYAL SPIRIT moved in early, rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved off the pace, went three then four wide on the far turn, rallied to make a bid into upper stretch, took the lead inside the three-sixteenths, led to near the sixteenth-pole then was overtaken while able to get the place. FIGHTER IN THE WIN was taken under a tight hold early, dropped in entering the first turn, reached the inside shortly thereafter, was rated off the pace, raced inside to the two path on the final turn, was asked three wide into the stretch, came out some and bumped with the winner inside the three-sixteenths, pursued the leader into the final sixteenth and finished with good courage for the show. SO HIGH (GB) was taken under a snug hold early, went three then two wide on the first turn, tracked the pace under tight restraint, made a bid with a half-mile to run, vied in the three path on the far turn, battled under a drive into the final furlong and weakened then just lost the show. HOLD THE SALSA was taken up after the start, went three wide on the first turn, was reserved at the rear on the outside, moved closer with five furlongs to run, came under urging while four then five wide on the far turn, brushed with an opponent while in good striking range in upper stretch and lacked the needed response. MO Z was reluctant to load, angled in while going to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked near the five-sixteenths, lost the advantage in upper stretch and gave way. BASSO went two then three wide on the first turn, prompted the pace on the outside, took a short lead on the far turn, dropped back under a drive in upper stretch and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: So High (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tigh hold,3-2p1st,rated,bid1/2,3p2nd,vied past 1/8,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1M Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 105000. (UP TO $18,270 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR OPTIO NAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Afterc are Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOVIE MOXY attended the leader under a rating hold to the outside five then four paths off the rail, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths as the leader began to slip away, angled six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying to take command and coming in under a right handed stick bumping with GERRYMANDER a sixteenth out, then edged away to the finish to prevail. GERRYMANDER showed the way rated on the pace four then three wide through moderate splits, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths attempting to slip away, swung five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a vigorous hand ride receiving two taps to the right side from the crop while under lone threat to the outside, got collared and bumped by MOVIE MOXY a sixteenth from home, had the rider go to a left handed crop inside that station and ran on to preserve the place honors clear of the rest. VENTI VALENTINE rated three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the five-sixteenths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch and weakened. TAP THE FAITH chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Venti Valentine
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable and Parkland Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3-2w, coaxed near 5/16, 2-3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Gerrymander
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated on pace 4p, 3w turn, coaxed 5/16, 5w uppr, caught, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Tap the Faith

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 10 6F Turf CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwi se Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Six Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LINARITE angled in while settling off the pace, went three wide on the turn, swung six wide into the stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong and closed strongly to get up late. DANCE WITH ME BABE showed speed then pressed the pace on the inside, vied along the rail on the turn, took a short lead at the quarter-pole, kicked clear while put to a drive in upper stretch, led into the final seventy yards but was caught while clear for the place. MO DAMORNINGGROUCH showed speed then was taken back off the pace under a tight hold, went around the turn in the two path, was asked for her best in upper stretch and lacked the needed kick while able to get the show. PAUCILOQUENT settled off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the turn, came five wide into the stretch, chased into the final furlong, drifted in outside the sixteenth-pole and lacked the needed response. APRIL FIRST angled in early, settled towards the rear, saved ground on the turn and failed to threaten. LADY BANKER broke a step slow, settled well back in the field, went three then two wide on the turn and failed to rally. MARY KATHERINE was hustled from the gate then settled on the outside, went three then four wide on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch, moved out in the final furlong and failed to respond. PUREST PERFORMANCE broke out then was corrected by the rider, was well placed just off the pace, came under urging in the three path on the turn, was driven four wide into the stretch, was taken in hand while off heels outside the furlong marker and had nothing left. RENT CONTROL moved up to take the lead with five furlongs to run, vied in the two path on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch, drifted out some inside the three-sixteenths and gave way. HAYFLATION was off slow and spotted the front several lengths, dropped well behind, saved ground on the turn and was no factor. MAXING THE BANK broke a step slow, angled in early, was taken in hand while off heels at the nine-sixteenths, raced inside to the two path on the turn and showed little.
